title: Leading causes of death among black U.S. residents in 2017
yAxis: Percentage of all causes of death
summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
There is a difference of 21.3 between the maximum Month Diseases of the heart and minimum Month Septicemia.
min_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Percentage of all causes of death in each Month on the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Month in the x axis and Percentage of all causes of death in the y axis.
The Percentage of all causes of death is appeared to be the highest at Month Diseases of the heart and lowest at Month Septicemia.
There is a difference of 21.3 between the maximum Month Diseases of the heart and minimum Month Septicemia.
max_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Month, and Percentage of all causes of death in each Month on the y axis.
The maximum Percentage of all causes of death 23.3 is found at Month Diseases of the heart and the minimum is found at Septicemia where Month is 2.0.
The difference of Percentage of all causes of death between the highest and lowest Month is 21.3.
Percentage of all causes of death at Month Diseases of the heart is 23.3 , second place is Malignant neoplasms (cancers) at 20.8, and thirdly is Accidents (unintentional injuries) at 5.9.
Overall Percentage of all causes of death has lowered over the Months.
The Month Septicemia has 3.15 times less Percentage of all causes of death than average.
Summing up the values of all Months, we get total 73.9.

data.Month: Nephritis nephrotic syndrome and nephrosis (kidney diseases)
